input_text:
Job Title: Project Manager

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Project Manager - Lunar Terrain VehicleHouston, Texas
About Intuitive Machines: Intuitive Machines is an innovative and cutting-edge space company making cislunar space accessible to both public and private customers. We believe our mission is to further research, communications, and exploration beyond low lunar orbit. With multiple NASA lunar missions in the making and additional private missions on our manifest, we pride ourselves in supporting NASA, our customers and the nation in paving the way to return humans to the surface of the moon. Our world-class team includes experts in all spacecraft subsystems design, development, and test, on-orbit operations, and safety.
Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Program Manager to join our dynamic team. As the prime contractor for the NASA Lunar Terrain Vehicle mission, Intuitive Machines is responsible for leading the design, development, and integration of cutting-edge technologies alongside our Moon RACER global team of companies including AVL, Boeing, Michelin, & Northrop Grumman. The Program Manager will play a key role in in working across company teams. 
Responsibilities:Lead the overall execution of the Lunar Terrain Vehicle project, ensuring adherence to schedule, budget, and quality requirements.Serve as the primary point of contact with NASA and other stakeholders, fostering strong relationships and ensuring clear communication throughout the project lifecycle.Collaborate closely with our Moon RACER global team of companies to drive the vehicle design architecture and oversee system integration efforts.Provide strategic direction and guidance to cross-functional teams, including engineering, manufacturing, and operations, to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives.Identify and mitigate project risks, proactively addressing issues and challenges to ensure successful project delivery.Monitor project performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs), providing regular updates to senior leadership and stakeholders.Lead project review meetings, including design reviews, milestone reviews, and technical interchange meetings, to assess progress and address any issues or concerns.Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, driving efficiencies and best practices across the project team.Mentor and coach junior team members, fostering their professional development and growth within the organization.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.Minimum of 10 years of experience in program or project management, with a track record of successfully leading complex aerospace projects.Extensive experience working with NASA or other government agencies, preferably in the space exploration domain.Strong technical background with knowledge of spacecraft design, propulsion systems, and/or robotics.Proven leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams to achieve project goals.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with senior leadership, customers, and stakeholders.Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and execute project plans that align with organizational objectives.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred.
Join Our Team: If you are passionate about space exploration and have the skills and experience to lead our Lunar Terrain Vehicle project to success, we want to hear from you. Join us at Intuitive Machines and be a part of shaping the future of space exploration.
US EEO StatementIntuitive Machines is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
